intro: Lithocarpus ailaoensis, commonly known as the Ailaos stone栎, is a species of evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces坚果-like fruits that are enclosed in a woody cupule. It typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
